name: Project Creator then Assessor
content:
## Objective
Turn {{goals}} into a fully scoped project blueprint, then stress-test the plan before sign-off.

## Context
- Role: project architect and reviewer.

## Inputs
- goals: {{goals}}

## Assumptions
Assumption: Exactly three rounds of three follow-up questions (Rounds 1–3); proceed with assumptions if answers are missing.
Assumption: Do not start planning until all rounds complete and insights summarized.

## Constraints
- Keep outputs concise and actionable; tables where specified.

## Instructions
1. Question rounds — Output Round 1–3 with exactly three questions each; capture answers or assumptions.
2. Discovery synthesis — Summarize goals, constraints, stakeholders, resources, dependencies, unknowns.
3. Project structuring — Define workstreams, milestones, deliverables, owners/roles, dependencies, timelines.
4. Execution backlog — Tasks per milestone with acceptance criteria, estimates, and measurement hooks.
5. Risk & mitigation — Strategic/operational/delivery risks with impact, likelihood, mitigations, triggers.
6. Assessment — Evaluate alignment, resources, sequencing, readiness; flag unresolved decisions.
7. Monitoring setup — KPIs, review cadence, tooling, escalation paths.

## Execution Flow
1) Rounds 1–3 questions
2) Synthesis
3) Blueprint
4) Backlog
5) Risks
6) Assessment
7) Monitoring

## Output Format
1. Question Rounds — Sections for Round 1–3 with exactly three numbered questions each (note assumptions).
2. Discovery Synthesis — Bulleted summary of confirmed facts, assumptions, and open items.
3. Project Blueprint — Table: Workstream | Milestone | Deliverables | Owner/Role | Due date (estimate) | Dependencies | Acceptance criteria.
4. Execution Backlog — Ordered list grouped by milestone with tasks, effort/duration, success measures, owners/TBD.
5. Risk Register — Table: Risk | Category | Impact | Likelihood | Mitigation | Trigger to revisit.
6. Assessment & Recommendations — Narrative plus go/no-go checklist with prerequisites.
7. Monitoring Plan — Bullets for KPIs, instrumentation, review cadence, escalation paths.

## Quality Checks
- Exactly three questions per round.
- Synthesis includes confirmed data and gaps.
- Blueprint covers scope, owners, dependencies, timelines, acceptance criteria.
- Risks include owners/triggers; cover strategic and execution layers.
- Assessment states readiness and blockers.

## Eval Stubs
- pass_if(rounds == 3 && questions_per_round == 3)
- pass_if(has_blueprint_table == true)
- pass_if(has_risk_register == true)

## Self-Check
If any Quality Check would fail, revise once before returning.
description: This template transforms high-level goals into fully scoped project blueprints with risk assessment to help you plan complex initiatives systematically. It runs 3 rounds of clarifying questions, structures workstreams/milestones/deliverables, and stress-tests the plan before sign-off. Output: project blueprint with tasks, risk matrix, KPIs, and readiness assessment. Use when starting new projects, scoping initiatives, or converting ideas into actionable plans with resource allocation.
